definition: to give it your all/to go at it with all you've got/to throw your whole weight behind it/also pr. [hun2 shen1 jie3 shu4]
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: He is a cheeper apparently, I make him purposely happy, exert all over skill.
sentences.chinese: 他明顯是個雛，我有心讓他快樂，使出了渾身解數。

sentences.english: It was a wake-up call for Milan who began to take the game seriously and utilise all their assets.
sentences.chinese: 米蘭方纔如夢初醒，認真對待比賽，使出渾身解數。

sentences.english: A: Did you see him fall all over himself making excuses?
sentences.chinese: 看到他使出渾身解數爲自己找藉口了嗎？

sentences.english: To figure out where disease-prevention dollars would be best spent, the scientists crunched the numbers.
sentences.chinese: 爲了弄清楚疾病預防的支出，科學家們使盡渾身解數。

sentences.english: The actress emoted for all she was worth.
sentences.chinese: 女演員施展渾身解數來表演。

definition: to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
unique skill/unexpected tricky move (as a last resort)/masterstroke/finishing blow
to compete to be the first to answer a question (as on a quiz show)
to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to do with the masses/mass (meeting, movement etc)
